channel.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
channel.description:
[html]

The Whonix Concept graphic is quite popular.

https://www.whonix.org/w/images/9/90/Whonix.jpg

It has been edited by me in a rush. The original is still available.

https://www.whonix.org/w/images/c/cb/TorBOX_Concept.jpg

Would someone like to contribute, refine the concept graphic, fix its obvious flaws?

Let’s discuss it in the forums in case you are interested: https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,558.0.html

[/html]

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
[html]

I can help.


[/html]

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Replaced on the main page. https://www.whonix.org

Took the one with red borders, because the black borders for the workstation was not visible at all. But it is true. Red borders are non-ideal. Perhaps we find a better color. One that is not red (as the color) and not black (that is invisible).

Read full topic

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: FIS
item.description:
No worries. If you need my help again feel free to contact me. I’ll be very willing to help you… with the red and black border lines, as troubadour suggested.

Read full topic
item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Ok. let’s use troubadour’s choice.

FIS, can you do these last adjustments please?

Oh, and FIS, could you stick with us for a while please after we changed it on whonix’s main page? When it goes live, we might get valid feedback on points we overlooked for now.

Read full topic

item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Just noticed, in the final there will be other words that need renaming.

“CONNECTION TORIFIED” became “CONNECTION / TORIFIED / SECURED”
“NON TORIFIED” became “CONNECTION / NON TORIFIED / UNSECURED”

The word “secured” implies to much. (For example, it doesn’t take into account: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Warning#Man-in-the-middle_attacks)

Could you change it back to the original when we picked the final please?

Read full topic
item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: troubadour
item.description:
http://7rea.com/d/1412985588863.jpg is my favorite.

Whonix-Gateway is smaller than Whonix-Worstation, as it should be because the user works in Workstation, and we live in a stormy world from which Whonix protects us in its humble way. Hallelujah. May be if the borders of the boxes were black ?

Read full topic
item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Looks great!

I am looking forward to comments on which is best.

For the final one, please keep the “-” in
Whonix-Gateway
Whonix-Workstation
. (We’re using that notation consistently everywhere.)

Read full topic

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Occq
item.description:
I would stay with terms that are used in the wider community. I don’t really connect “misbehaving” with software but it’s not a big deal.

I think the green round arrow is OK, host is on the far left. Still interested in FIS’s alternative, though.

Little red arrow confuses me a bit. I have to say I prefer the lot of red arrow as portrayed in the original.

Read full topic
item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: FIS
item.description:
Everything else was square, it’s good to have something round… Ok, we will try something else.

Read full topic
item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
The round, green arrow on the left is not so good because it’s going up seemingly through the host first. It’s better in the original. Also because it says: isolated network

Also we’re two times using the red color. Once for misbehaving applications and once for untorified host traffic. Not sure how, but can we do this some other way?

Read full topic

item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Good point. “malicious” creates more negative associations than necessary.

  • What about replacing “malicious or misbehaving” with “compromised or misbehaving”?
  • What about replacing “malicious or misbehaving” with simply “misbehaving”? (I like this more.)

Any opinions?

Read full topic
item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!

item.title: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
item.dc:creator: Tuggboat
item.description:
This isn’t so much about layout. The whole red arrow, malicous applications can’t break out concept confuses me. At best i think a trojan can’t phone home, at the worst I think that the workstation is infected. I have a firewall that keeps infections isolated if and when I have them and its linux so it shouldn’t be infected in the first place.

So this leads me to another idea that the Whonix workstation would be a good place to develop malware. This may indeed be true but the idea made public could have an impact on trustworthiness in general and more widespread adoption. Most of my friends are suspicous of anybody looking at privacy and anonymity anyhow.

But I could see the idea of keeping a buggy program in. If you were to say something like bugged application in development, I think the general public, or at least myself, could see the whole project as good instead of suspicous. or “used by suspicous Tuggboats”

Further along these lines, some application development tools bring in some revenue streams from sources with more resources. A bigger fish so to say. It almost has to be a part of a bigger idea, with isolated entities" to engineer these types of modern revenue streams but that way outside this topic.

Suffice to say the red arrows and their captions confuse me and lead my mind to wondering.

Read full topic
item.source: Refinement of Whonix Concept Graphic - Help wanted!
